javadoc:
Class used by some generic constraints to fulfill their requirement to provide and editor. These types
 of constraints are passed in an EditorProvider in their constructor.  This allows these constraint
 types to be created using generics without subclassing.
@param <T> the constraint type.

methods.name: getEditor
methods.comment: Returns an editor initialized to the given columnConstraint.

params.name: columnConstraint
params.comment: the constraint whose value is to be edited.

params.name: columnData
params.comment: the context of the data in the table.

return.comment: an editor initialized to the given columnConstraint.

methods.name: parseValue
methods.comment: Parses the given string into a T object.

return.comment: a new T object created by parsing the given string.

methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Converts the T value into a string that can be parsed back by the #parseValue(String, Object) method.

params.name: value
params.comment: the value to convert to a parsable string.

return.comment: The parsable string fromthe T value.

name: EditorProvider
comment:
Class used by some generic constraints to fulfill their requirement to provide and editor. These types
 of constraints are passed in an EditorProvider in their constructor.  This allows these constraint
 types to be created using generics without subclassing.
